name: Hadleys Hotel

reviews.text: Great location, beautiful building however the room was very tried, poor lighting and in need of repair. The toilet was continually running and the safe was not working on arrival.
reviews.title: Great location
What a let down!
reviews.text: There was no information regarding the hotel or local attractions available in the room.

I have stayed here a few times and always been iffy on the place, usually because the town was busy and had little options. This time the hotel had just changed hands and the experience was terrible! No TV remote, no way to control room temp, safe wouldn't lock not sure it was just my room but after having a fantastic tine everywhere else we went, this was a let down. Hope they sort this out soon. Foyer had been refurb end recently so hopefully this carries on through remainder of hotel it needs it.
reviews.title: Tired, grubby and overrated.

reviews.text: The location is the only thing going for this hotel. It is central and relatively cheap. The rooms have no ceiling lights only bedside lamps so are dark and feel dingy. We had a twin which was very narrow and looked out onto the tin roof and back of nowhere. The bathroom had black mould marks and needs a renovation. The next door bathroom noises and voices could be heard through the thin walls, the passage door needs a sound proofing seal. This was a grand old lady! She now is in need of more than a facelift. We chose to move to another motel for the remainder of our stay in Hobart. We did not eat here! When we spoke to reception about our disappointment the response was they had just change hands! It felt as if they had heard it a lot!
reviews.title: Good location - very small shoe box room
Location, charm and service save the day.
reviews.text: Great Location - for shops and Market. Too far away from car park with all our luggage which was not mentioned on website. First off given the wrong directions by the receptionist, so had to drive back and get them again. There was no mention of a charge to park the car on the website so was surprised to be charged $15 per night. Room same shape as a shoe box. Clean, windows rattle and so did the door. Lisa the Bar tender was so friendly and helpful. Jimmy the piano player was terrific. We sat and listened for hours. He brought a wonderful light atmosphere to the place on Saturday night. A real high light for our stay.

reviews.title: Long weekend at beautiful Hadleys
reviews.text: Hadleys is in an excellent location for tourists, close to cbd, Salamanca and all the waterfront activities.The hotel has recently changed hands and after a minor mix up due to the previous owners the staff were great especially Rosie who went out of her way to not only fix the problem but looked after us for anything we needed help with the entire stay. The rooms and hotel are old world charm and very spacious, very different from your usual hotel. We will definitely be back to stay at the Hadleys and cant wait to see what the new owners bring to this beautiful hotel.

reviews.title: A great time at the Hadleys Hotel
Convenient to cd with charm
reviews.text: An older hotel with high ceilings and interesting architecture. Rooms a good size (I was in an upgrade I think). Bed was comfortable and pretty quiet on 3rd floor at night. Staff were very nice tocdea l with. Breakfast was just ok. Very handy to anywhere in cd.

reviews.title: $200 for a box room!!
reviews.text: Great location then the good points stop. Smallest room we have ever stayed in could hardly get a single case in and then be able to move around. Old CRT TV and furnishings from a council clean up. Very disappointing for the cost. There are much better and cheaper hotels in Hobart AVOID HADLEYS

I am currently staying at Hadley's. I came back to my room to find bunk beds installed in my lounge area for incoming guests. No one asked if this was Ok by me. I accept that rooms need to be accessed for cleaning etc, but while I am here this is my space. The hotel has no right to come into my living area and cram additional bedding into it while I am still using it. I probably would have given permission if asked.
reviews.title: Private space not respected

reviews.text: I travel frequently for work and leisure and have never seen this level of disrespect towards a guest.
reviews.title: Shabby not chic
Olde world charm
reviews.text: Hadleys has a great location - one street from the centre of Hobart and a short walk to Salamanca. The hotel is Victorian in style, with an olde world charm. The room I stayed in had a lovely view of the church across the road and was very comfortable. Staff were most helpful and very friendly. Most enjoyable stay.

aka: Grand Mercure Hobart Hadleys Hotel And Apartments
description: Hadleys Hotel, Hobart is the oldest continuously operating boutique hotel in Tasmania. Originally constructed in 1834, this National Trust listed hotel is a unique place to stay in the heart of the city. The fully restored 71 room hotel features the atrium- style Restaurant 1834 and also The Lobby Bar. Just 20 min from the airport and 5 min walk from the business and government centre of Hobart, Salamanca Markets, Constitution Dock and CBD shopping. Located right in the heart of the city, directly opposite the beautiful St Davids Church.
